intro: Daucus laserpitioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved carrot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Daucus laserpitioides is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
